channel.title: Posts on Liam Getreu
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Liam Getreu

item.title: Haaretz op-ed: 'How Australia’s New Leaders Really See Israel and the Palestinians'
item.description: Following Labor’s federal election win, I wrote this op-ed for Israeli newspaper Haaretz on what it means for the Australia-Israel relationship:

item.title: NIF event: Peace, War and the Future with Former Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Olmert
item.description: I interviewed former Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Olmert for an NIF event about his latest book Searching for Peace, his new political memoir.

item.title: NIF event: Ohad Naharin on BDS, Israel-Palestine and the Sydney Festival
item.description: Over the last month, calls to boycott the Sydney Festival after it received sponsorship from the Israeli embassy for a production of Naharin’s Decadance have featured prominently on social and mainstream media.

item.title: Sydney Morning Herald op-ed: 'Sydney Festival boycott a blunt instrument that blocks voices of dissent'
item.description: Following pressure on the Sydney Festival to reject funding from the Israeli embassy to host Ohad Naharin and the Batsheva Dance Company’s Decadance, I wrote this op-ed for the Sydney Morning Herald:

item.title: NIF event: In conversation with Senator Penny Wong
item.description: For the event celebrating 10 years since the New Israel Fund’s establishment in Australia we hosted a number of speakers, including a conversation with Senator the Hon.

item.title: Quoted: Australian Government Adopts IHRA Definition
item.description: I was quoted in a Guardian Australia article on the Australian government’s adoption of the International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) working definition of antisemitism.

item.title: NIF event: Foreign Correspondents Speak Out
item.description: For this NIF event, I moderated a discussion with John Lyons, the author of a new book, Dateline Jerusalem which looks at how Israel is covered by the Australian media and a former Middle East Correspondent for the Australian, Anshel Pfeffer senior correspondent and columnist for Haaretz and the Israeli correspondent for the Economist and Dina Kraft, a Tel Aviv-based journalist for the Los Angeles Times and Christian Science Monitor, to hear how foreign correspondents work to tell other people’s stories and shape the discourse in their home country.

item.title: Quoted: Ben & Jerry's
item.description: I was quoted in an Australian Jewish News article today about Ben & Jerry’s announcement it would no longer sell its ice cream in Israeli settlements in the West Bank:

item.title: Quoted: New Israeli Government Without Netanyahu
item.description: I was quoted in the Australian Jewish News as Benjamin Netanyahu was replaced as prime minister by Naftali Bennett.

item.title: Interviewed on PM on Israel's new government
item.description: I was interviewed on ABC’s PM program after Naftali Bennett’s government was sworn in.

item.title: Interviewed on ABC's The World in the aftermath of the Gaza war and violence inside Israeli mixed towns
item.description: In the aftermath of the escalation of violence between Israel and Palestinians I was interviewed on ABC’s The World with Beverley O’Connor.

item.title: News.com.au: The violence Gaza conflict is hiding
item.description: News.com.au published my op-ed on the ongoing crisis affecting Jewish-Arab shared society in Israel:

item.title: NIF event: Adam Bandt and Tamar Zandberg on progressive politics
item.description: I had the privilege to interview two leaders shaping their country’s political conversations – Adam Bandt, leader of the Australian Greens, and Tamar Zandberg, Knesset member and former leader of Israel’s Meretz – on how they are shifting the political goal posts and taking decisive action rooted in shared values of equality, democracy and justice.

item.title: Quoted: Escalation in Gaza
item.description: I was quoted in a Guardian Australia article today about the ongoing escalation of violence in Gaza:

item.title: Labor’s resolution ‘doesn’t undermine support for Israel’
item.description: The Australian Jewish News published my op-ed on resolutions about Israel-Palestine at Labor’s recent national conference.

item.title: NIF's Israel Election Preview, March 2021
item.description: With Israel going to its fourth election in two years we again produced a series of preview videos to explain the big issues to our donors and supporters.

item.title: NIF event: What the Biden-Harris Administration Means for the Middle East
item.description: Less than two weeks after President Joe Biden took office, I interviewed seasoned American Middle East negotiator, and NIF board member, Aaron David Miller and former Knesset member Ksenia Svetlova about how America’s Middle East policy will shift under the new administration.

item.title: NIF event: Achinoam Nini & Mira Awad on Music & Jewish-Arab Partnership
item.description: I facilitated this wonderful event with Jewish Israeli singer Achinoam Nini (Noa) and Palestinian Israeli singer Mira Awad where we discussed their ongoing efforts to create a more equal and tolerant society for all Israelis and Palestinians and heard some of their beautiful music.

item.title: NIF event: Democracy in Danger
item.description: With democracy and pluralism under attack around the world, I interviewed New York Times columnist Roger Cohen and academic and former deputy Knesset speaker Naomi Chazan to delve further into this troubling trend in the United States, Israel and all around the world.

item.title: NIF event: Interviewing Thomas Friedman
item.description: This week I interviewed New York Times columnist Thomas Friedman about the US election, the Trump presidency and the Middle East.

item.title: NIF event: Interviewing Kevin Rudd
item.description: As a former prime minister and foreign minister, there are few people with a better understanding of Australia’s role in the world and our history with the Israeli-Palestinian conflict than Kevin Rudd.

item.title: Quoted: Abraham Accords
item.description: I was quoted in an Australian Jewish News article today about the Abraham Accords:

item.title: On ABC News discussing Israel’s plans for annexation
item.description: I was on ABC The World discussing Israel’s plans for annexation and the Australian government’s response.

item.title: NIF event: In conversation with Martin Indyk
item.description: With Prime Minister Netanyahu actively advancing plans to annex parts of the West Bank and President Trump pushing his own plan for the Middle East, I interviewed former US ambassador to Israel and former US special envoy for Israeli-Palestinian negotiations – not to mention NIF Australia’s co-patron!

item.title: Quoted: Annexation
item.description: I was quoted in an Australian Jewish News article today about Israel’s plans to annex parts of the West Bank:

item.title: Discussing the Trump deal, Israeli annexation, elections and President Rivlin’s visit to Australia on ABC News
item.description: The White House has hailed the Middle East peace plan the "deal of the century", but Palestinian leaders are calling it a conspiracy - @liamget from @NIFAustralia tells @bevvo14 whether the deal could lead to more conflict.

item.title: NIF's Israel Election Preview, September 2019
item.description: After our series ahead of April 2019’s election was received well by NIF’s donors and supporters we produced another series for the do-over election in September of the same year.

item.title: Quoted: Escalation in Israel & Gaza
item.description: I was quoted in the Australian Jewish News about the recent escalation in violence in Israel & Gaza:

item.title: NIF's Israel Election Preview, April 2019
item.description: Ahead of Israel’s election in April 2019, NIF Australia produced a number of short videos to help our supporters understand issues at play, polling trends and the major players.

item.title: Quoted: Netanyahu Embraces Kahanism
item.description: I was quoted in the Australian Jewish News on Prime Minister Netanyahu’s embrace of a racist anti-Arab party of neo-Kahanists.

item.title: On the Australian government’s decision to recognise West Jerusalem
item.description: I was interviewed for AM in gauging reactions from the Jewish and Palestinian communities on the Australian government’s announcement regarding West Jerusalem.

item.title: Discussing Israel’s new 'Nation-State Law' on ABC News The World
Interviewed on ABC RN Drive with Pulitzer Prize winner Geraldine Brooks
item.description: On 20 June, an interview on ABC RN Drive aired with Pulitzer Prize winner Geraldine Brooks and me, discussing the compilation of essays ‘Kingdom of Olives and Ash’, Geraldine’s contribution and the now 51-year occupation of the Palestinian Territories:

item.title: Australian Jewish News: Time to end the occupation
item.description: The Australian Jewish News published my op-ed marking fifty years of Israel’s occupation of the Palestinian territories.

item.title: Interviewed on 7.30 in segment on Israel's crackdown on human rights organisations
item.description: I was interviewed on 7.30 as part of a report on the Israeli government’s proposed new laws aimed at curtailing the activities of human rights organisations.

item.title: Politicians' pandering does no good for Israel
item.description: My op-ed on the Republican primaries was published in ABC’s The Drum:
